www.lawcommission.gov.np  
 
 
1 
 Births, Deaths and Other Personal Events  (Registration) Rules, 2034 (1977)  
 
 
             Date of publication in the Nepal Gazette  
 
  2034 -4-10 (25 July , 1977)  
Amendment    
1. Births,   Deaths   and   Other   Personal  
Events (Registration) (First Amendment)  
Rules, 2064 (2008)              2065 -2-13(26 May , 2008)     
 
2. Births,   Deaths   and   Other   Personal  
Events (Reg istration) (Second  Amendment)  
Rules, 2075  (2018)             2075 -6-8(24 September, 201 8)    
 
 
In exercise of the powers conferred by Section 17 of the Births, Deaths and 
Other Personal Events (Registration) Act, 2033 (1976), Government of Nepal has 
framed the following Rules.  
 
1. Short Title and Commencement : (1) These Rules  may be called as  "Births, 
Deaths and Other Personal Events (Registration) Rules, 2034 (1977)".  
(2) These Rules shall come into force immediately.  
 
2. Definitions : Unless the subject or the context otherwise requires, in  these 
Rules, - 
(a) "Act" means the Births, Deaths and Other Personal Events 
(Registration) Act, 2033 (1976).  
(b) "Informant" means the person with a duty to notify a personal event 
pursuant to the Act.  
3. Functions and Duties of Registrar : In addition to the functions and  duties 
mentioned elsewhere in the se Rules, the functions and duties of the Registrar shall 
be as follows:  
 
(a) To give direction to the local registrars on registration of personal 
events,  
(b) To take necessary  action on complaints made against the local registrars, 
accusing them of lingering the informants unnecessarily by not 
registering the personal events in due course of time or by not issuing 
the registration certificate,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
 
 
2 
 To give p ermission to the local registrars on the correction of the details 
of a personal event already registered and alteration of a name already 
registered,  
(c) To specify the format of monthly statement of personal events 
registration to be forwarded by the office of the local registrar,  
(d) To give necessary suggestions to Government of Nepal on the statistics 
of personal events registration,  
(e) To prepare annual reports on personal events registration and submit to 
Government of Nepal,  
(f) To carry out necessary functions to  fulfill the objective of the Act and 
the Rules in respect of registration of personal events.  
4. Inventory of Family : (1) Government of Nepal may designate  necessary 
employees to prepare an inventory of families for purposes of registering personal 
events and cause such employees to prepare the inventory of families in a format 
as referred to in Schedule -1. 
(2) The inventory of families prepared pursuant to Sub -rule (1) shall be 
maintained at the Registrar's Office and the concerned inventory of families 
shall be altered according to the monthly statements of personal events 
registration forwarded by the local registrars pursuant to Rule 13.  
5. To Give Notice of Personal Events  : (1) The informant shall give a  notice of 
the following personal events to the local re gistrar's office in a format as referred to 
in the following schedules within the time -limitation as prescribed in the Act.  
Personal event   Form  
     
(a) Birth   Schedule - 2 
(b) Death  Schedule - 3 
(c) Marriage  Schedule - 4 
(d) Divorce  Schedule - 5 
(e) Migration  Schedule - 6 
 
(2) If the name of a child is not yet been given at the time when the 
notice of the birth is given, the name of such a child may be registered later.  
(3) The forms referred to in Sub -rule (1) shall be provided to the 
informant at free of cost.  
6. Registration of Personal Events  : Upon receipt of a notice as referred  to in 
Rule 5, the Local Registrar shall carry out the functions pursuant to the Act and 
register the notice of the following personal event in the register book as referred 
to in the following Schedule.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
 
 
3 
 Personal event    Register Book  
(a) Birth   Schedule - 7 
(b) Death   Schedule - 8 
(c) Marriage   Schedule - 9 
(d)        Divorce                                                                      Schedule - 10 
(e) Migration       Schedule - 11 
 
7. Issuance of Registration Certificate : Upon a registration of a notice  of 
personal event pursuant to Rule 6, the Local Registrar shall issue the registration 
certificate as referred to in the following Schedule to the informant of the following 
personal event.  
Personal event   Registration certificate  
(a) Birth  Schedule - 12 
(b) Death  Schedule - 13 
(c) Marriage  Schedule - 14 
(d) Divorce  Schedule - 15 
(e) Migration  Schedule - 16 
 
8. Issuance of copy of Certificate : (1) If the personal event registration  
certificate is lost or destroyed in any manner, the concerned person shall submit an 
application to the local registrar's office for a copy of such a certificate.  
(2) Upon receipt of the application as referred to in Sub -rule (1), the 
local registrar shall issue a copy of the registration certificate bearing the date 
and signature, by mentioning the issuance of the copy of the registration 
certificate in the remarks column of the concerned Register Book and levying a 
fee of Five rupees.  
9. Corre ction in Details : (1) If the details (particulars) of a registered  personal 
event to be corrected for any reason, the concerned person shall submit an 
application, setting out such reason, accompanied by the concerned certificate, to 
the local registrar's office.  
(2) Upon receipt of the application as referred to in Sub -rule (1), the 
local register shall, with permission of the Registrar, make corrections as per the 
application in the concerned Register Book and in the certificate as well. The 
fee of one rupee shall be charged in correcting such registered details.  
10. Registration of Child's Name and Alteration in Registered Name : (1) 
The concerned person shall submit an application,  accompanied by the concerned 
certificate, to the local registrar's office for regi stration of the name of a child 
pursuant to Sub -rule (2) of Rule 5.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
 
 
4 
 (2) Upon receipt of the application as referred to in Sub -rule (1), the 
local registrar shall register the name as mentioned in the application in the 
concerned Register Book and also mention the name in the certificate, and also 
indicate date and sign therein.  
(3) The local registrar shall give information of the name registration 
pursuant to Sub -rule (2) to the Registrar's Office immediately.  
(4) If the already registered name of any person is to be altered, the 
concerned person shall submit an application, setting out the reason therefor, 
accompanied by the concerned certificate, to the concerned local registrar's 
office.  
(5) Upon receipt of the application referred to in Sub -rule (4), the local 
registra r shall, with the permission of the Registrar, write down the altered name 
in the remarks column of the concerned Register Book with date and signature 
and also in the certificate. The fee of One Rupee shall be charged in so altering 
the already registered  name.  
11. Inspection of Register Book : If the concerned person submits an  application 
for inspection of the personal events Register Book, the local registrar may allow 
that person to inspect the Register Book in his/her presence by levying the 
inspection fee  of One Rupee.  
111A.  Fees  to be deposited in the Fund : (1) The fees and other amount  pursuant to 
the Act and these Rules except the fine to be received pursuant to Section 13 of the 
Act shall be deposited in the fund of the Village Development Committee or  
Municipality.  
(2) The amount deposited pursuant to Sub -rule (1) shall be expended 
in the personal event registration activities.  
12. Making Application : (1) If the concerned person is unable to read and  write, in 
submitting an application pursuant to the Act and the Rules, the local registrar shall 
him/herself write down or get any one to write down the matter as stated by the 
concerned person and get that person to set thumb impressions.  
(2) No fee shall be charged in making application pursuant to this Act 
or these Rules.  
13. Forwarding Monthly Statement : The local registrar's office shall  forward 
monthly statements of the personal events registration in the format as prescribed 
                                                      
1 Inserted by the First Amendment.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
 
 
5 
 by the Registrar's Office to the Registrar's Office within the first week of the next 
month.  
14. Maintaining Records : The Registrar's Office shall collect and analyse  the 
details obtained pursuant to Rule 13 and maintain updated records of personal 
events registration.  
 
15. Alteration in Schedule : Government of Nepal may, by a Notification  published 
in Nepal Gazette, make alterations in the Schedules as per necessity.

www.lawcommission.gov.np

Documents to be attached:

2. Report of birth issued by the health institution/hospital if born there:  
3. If born at the house, evidence of the last vaccination:  
4. In the absence of evidence of the hospital or vaccination, to get the person of whom 
birth registration is required to be registered to appear in person or document issued 
by the concerned Ward certifying the birth of the person of whom birth registration is 
required to be registered,  
5. In the case of foreigner, copy of father’s and mother’s passport or evidence showing 
residence in the concerned Ward,  
6. In the case of an Indian citizen, evidence wetting out the identity  that he or she is 
Indian citizen,  
7. If the father is disappearing or his whereabouts are not known, the letter of police in 
that respect.
